full_text:
Today I saw that @FiveThirtyEight has a higher elo value for Big Ben than for Russell Wilson (which surprised me), so I decided to look at the data and plot current QB values in elo points including the changes after week 1. Look at Aaron Rodgers' drop off... 
#nflverse https://t.co/QLQlZwnNH3
#nflverse https://t.co/kqI9mmCG9O
Pace and efficiency charts updated with week 2 stats #nflverse https://t.co/G7cfCWAius

A more realistic use-case of the gtExtras::gt_plt_bullet() inside a {gt} table below. The core table is ~8 lines of code.

Several high-profile QBs struggled in Wk 1, 2021 (dropped > 32 %-points from 2020).

Data: @ESPNStatsInfo & #nflverse 

#rstats Code: https://t.co/1UQikNjFnx https://t.co/OlKMjwwdKu

@tejfbanalytics @LeeSharpeNFL Ooh nice!

Note that {nflreadr} now is the "better" method of getting Lee's data.

#nflverse

https://t.co/eFFO6qKrAc

Yearly reminder of Josh Allen's dominance against the Miami Dolphins üî•

Data: @nflfastR | #nflverse https://t.co/g4r9a9i7mF

Time to overreact to small sample sizes! Will be posting the defensive efficiency charts each week again this season. Although these values may not fully stabilize until ~wk7, they are still fun to look at. Bonus internet points to anyone who can find the Chargers logo
#nflverse https://t.co/UXk1rJMCDb

we summarized the public 'overreaction' narratives for every NFL team following week 1 + how these perceptions have helped move week 2 spreads, using last week's 'lookahead line' and the spring preseason line as proxies ü§ì

#nflverse https://t.co/tY5QPeA9xZ

NFL week 2 summary of where bettors are putting cash to work üèàü§ëüéØ

#nflverse #rstats #gamblingtwitter https://t.co/6nE4tmghTd

How big is your Quarterback's DICK? Introducing the Demonstration of Innate Confidence and Killer-instinct, aka DICK size. It ranks QBs by their Air Yards per attempt and Pass TDs per game. https://t.co/16Ray3N1Px

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/Y1b6EOFzEo

Do NFL teams attempt longer passes when losing? Yes, kind of. 

See every team's break down here: https://t.co/KZzUGSkCcO

#nflverse #python #dataviz https://t.co/28GHibJiwY

NFL QB DICK Size: The Gunslinger Index. 

Does your QB Demonstrate Innate Confidence and Killer-instinct? https://t.co/gra7Vg8TJH

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/96Hn5EB5AC

Carson Wentz trick y'all man...he just running around doing nothing.

The man had the 4th *highest* average time to throw among all QBs in Week 1 but still had the 4th *lowest* Average Target Depth.
#nflverse https://t.co/hL8s2rozod

Why there's basically no need to worry for #Jets fans: Justin Herbert was almost worse all-around against Bill Belichick as a rookie than Wilson was this week. Herbert still ended up winning the rookie of the year. #nflverse https://t.co/5Fy3smetkY

I stole a lot of the ideas from the #nflverse because it's the premier resource for messing with football stats and while there are countless great hockey sites out there, it's harder to find places with just the raw play-by-play.

Not anymore! https://t.co/iVSlLINFvS
@letzgoterps @WeHateRob Have no idea besides @nflfastR #nflverse

I've taken another crack at summarizing NFL team game performance.

Inspired by @EvolvingHockey's GAR charts, these plots show each play from a given game and how much (& in what direction) it impacted the possession team's expected points.

#nflverse

https://t.co/SW1FIprbuq https://t.co/qlQ4xmW7ga

Pass&Rush charts updated for all week 1 teams. Surprised to see BAL's overall offense not only ended up below average, but their rushing success rate was *squints* 2nd to last in the league.

#tableau #nflverse https://t.co/Qr1kXeFh7j

Team Efficiency charts, Week 2

the üëèBroncosüëè are üëèa üëètopüëè 2 üëèoffense üëè

#tableau #nflverse https://t.co/axvtYjJuRd

The model has made it's adjustments after week one, and boy does it love the @Eagles a liiiiitttle too much.  But that's the nature of Bayesian modelling with relatively uninformed priors! #nflverse @nflseedR https://t.co/2zq0HR3AuR https://t.co/n3MGgy8hm7

Week 2 is on the books and the model has made some adjustments - still a lot of variance in the estimates of team strength, but I expect next week's games will provide a ton of clarity #nflverse https://t.co/2zq0HR3AuR https://t.co/XKyexOongG

And here are the week 3 projections - the model made some great calls in week 2, but overall missed the mark.  The historical data suggests more predictive accuracy is coming, but we'll see how it plays out using @FiveThirtyEight and @LeeSharpeNFL prediction games! #nflverse https://t.co/Rud1PeQKsp
How to get snap count data using nflreadr #nflverse https://t.co/0jprTCsRVJ
Per @nflfastR the Raiders have a pass rate over expectation of 9.6%, the highest rate among teams that have played two games already. #nflverse

#nflverse QB's 2021 adjusted EPA per play charted against their career adjusted EPA per play - highlighting QBs who have played significantly outside their norm (i.e. Tannehill, Rodgers, Ryan, Winston, etc.) https://t.co/VqGtQCFrmV

QB Adjusted EPA per Play through week 2. The idea is that quarterbacks will regress towards their career averages, so compared to the first two weeks expect more from:
-Tannehill
-Ryan
-Burrow 

And expect less from:
-Mahomes
-Garappolo
-Stafford
-Bridgewater
#nflverse https://t.co/H1fHYCr7nR

Sacks from Chandler Jones were the most impactful sacks from any individual player in any game since at least 1999. The five plays where he sacked Ryan Tannehill (which included two fumbles and a fourth down stop) cost the Titans 18.3 expected points.

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/XUJId4EPJW

The Jets and Panthers were the only two teams in Week 1 who played each of their top six picks from the 2021 draft.

The Jets, Steelers, WFT, and Browns all gave each of their top three picks at least a 30% snap share in Week 1.

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/WT0WjiuZod

Daniel Jones had his sixth career turnover-free game last night. He has the lowest rate of turnover-free games among QBs who have had at least 10 dropbacks in 25 games since 1999.

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/LL6NllnvHt

#nflverse Win probabilities are back for Week 2!

Thread below for all NFL win probabilities generated by my Elo rating model: https://t.co/xdnaQONToD

QB Accuracy and Average Depth of Target #nflverse 

Davis Mills has 9 fewer air yards than Andy Dalton on 31 fewer attempts üò¨ https://t.co/8YtzQ4OuDv

For this season, the sample is small, but mac jones had a great start. Patriots have run a conservative playbook with aDot below 6 yds. Nobody qb rookie has it since '13 with at least 50 att. Hope for Lawrence and Wilson that they will come back over the average for epa
#nflverse https://t.co/r7BFFnwaQp

Best performing #NFL teams through Week 1 as represented by expected points added (EPA) for/against. For those unaware of EPA and how its used to evaluate aspects of team and player performance, check out the below post by the @The33rdTeamFB. #nflverse

https://t.co/D2Xp2GgNj3 https://t.co/wMTNQTuEiD

A bit spoken about KC's run defense through 2 weeks, despite them facing CLE and BAL. Tried replicating a similar (and cool) plot by @benbbaldwin using {ggforce} to show team success against the run b/w '20 and '21. Small sample, but a noticeable drop-off for KC. #nflverse https://t.co/OXWwF4mVZL

My @Twitter sports update features a tweet from ‚Ä¶ me. 

#nflverse #NFL #herewego https://t.co/Rk3rr1DYeT

The #FantasyFootball community needs an awareness campaign to support when an NFL player goes down for injury. Not all of us are jerks, and rooting for an injury/calling out injured players on social media is classless. Get well @RMos_8Ball  #nflverse #NFL

Ravens rushing attack was historically efficient in 2019 & 2020. EPP is often negative for run plays, but Lamar offenses have maintained neutral-to-positive EPP. 

Not last night. A lot of runs to the left guard and right tackle, but they weren't very effective. #nflverse https://t.co/JXuSU8gYfs

The Ravens-Raiders matchup featured 5 swings in win probability of at least 20%. Four of those 5 had the Ravens on the ~losing~ end of those plays.

Next up, a Chiefs team that lives and dies by the big play, coming off a dramatic comeback... #nflverse https://t.co/l37pgu6uwV

One thing from Week 1 that was familiar for the Ravens? Taking a long time to snap the ball. Baltimore had the 6th lowest average time remaining on the play clock at the snap in 2020 at 8.8 secs and the 5th lowest in Week 1 at 7.2 secs. #nflverse https://t.co/FwIg35mTkl
Happily holding it over the rest of the #nflverse squad that I'm beating them in @LeeSharpeNFL's predictions contest...primarily off of the Steelers winning, no less! https://t.co/LJQqp6xCXY

Tonight on-stream: futzing with ffsimulator to try and make a "wins-added" metric specific to your fantasy league :) 

#nflverse

Live at about 8pm EDT!

@RealSkipBayless said the @dallascowboys are 25-0 when they run more than pass. So I decided to beat the dead horse that is RUN != WIN. https://t.co/hsoZiRlNi2

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/lQ2lXFwLhs
